title: Sam Alvey: Broken hand behind 'heartbreaking' withdrawal vs. 'Shogun' Rua at UFC on ESPN+ 22
text:
Sam Alvey has confirmed a broken hand was the culprit behind his withdrawal from the UFC on ESPN+ 22 co-main event against Mauricio Rua.

As was first reported by Combate, Alvey (33-13 MMA, 10-8 UFC) was recently forced to pull out of his scheduled light heavyweight matchup with former UFC champ Rua (26-11 MMA, 10-9 UFC) on the Nov. 16 card, which takes place at Ginásio do Ibirapuera in Sao Paulo and streams on ESPN+.

On Sunday, Alvey confirmed the report and shared an X-ray as well as a statement with details about what happened to his left hand (via Instagram):

I’m here to tell you some unfortunate news, I broke my hand the other day in practice punching a guy int he head. It wasn’t a good punch. Maybe it was a great punch? He’s fine. So it wasn’t that good of a punch. Unfortunately I have to pull out of my fight with “Shogun.” It’s heartbreaking. Hand breaking and heart breaking. It’s a fight I’ve wanted my whole career. He’s just such an incredible athlete, such an incredible fighter. I was excited to share the octagon with him and I’m so sorry “Shogun” for you and your team. I don’t mean to do this to you. Whoever they get to replace me I hope you win that fight then you and I can run it back. We’ll make it a great one someday. Good luck on the rest of your camp. I’m going to heal as fast as I can and I’ll be back in that octagon as fast as I can be. Thank you for all your support.

Alvey’s withdrawal from UFC on ESPN+ 22 marks just the second time in his 18-fight UFC tenure that he’s pulled out of a scheduled bout. The other time came in February 2016.

“Shogun” is now left without an opponent, and with 20 days until the event, no replacement has been announced.
